risk_factors.factor1: education level (high school diploma vs. college)
risk_factors.textual reasoning: College-educated individuals are more likely to have a support system in place and be less prone to recidivism.

risk_factors.factor2: employment history (2 jobs vs. stable employment)
risk_factors.textual reasoning: Stable employment can provide a sense of security and stability, reducing the likelihood of recidivism.
Married individuals are more likely to have a support system in place and be less prone to recidivism.
Having a larger household can provide a sense of security and stability, reducing the likelihood of recidivism.

risk_factors.factor5: religiosity (considering God has something to do with what happens)
risk_factors.textual reasoning: Religious beliefs can provide a sense of purpose and motivation, helping individuals avoid recidivism.
Having grown up in an unstable environment may indicate a lack of resilience or coping mechanisms, increasing the risk of recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 185 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 4. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
